subject: Career
title: Cortisol: The Stress Hormone
description: A quick, practical guide to Cortisol: The Stress Hormone.

hook.text: Cortisol wakes you up each morning. It sharpens focus during crises. But too much cortisol destroys your body and mind.

buildup.text: Cortisol is produced by the adrenal glands. Short bursts enhance performance. Chronic elevation causes damage.

discovery.text: Elevated cortisol shrinks the prefrontal cortex (decision-making) and enlarges the amygdala (fear response).

twist.text: Chronic high cortisol also suppresses immunity, disrupts sleep, and promotes belly fat storage.

climax.text: Exercise, sleep, social connection, and mindfulness all lower cortisol. The antidote is biology, not willpower.

punchline.text: Cortisol is your friend in a sprint. Your enemy in a marathon.

quiz.question: What happens when cortisol levels stay elevated chronically?
options: The prefrontal cortex shrinks and the amygdala enlarges
